(4, 1, 1): Analytical writing, quantitative reasoning and verbal reasoning.
(5, 1, 1): Admissions to master's and doctoral degree programs in various universities
(7, 1, 1): About 3 hours and 45 minutes (includes 1-minute breaks after each section and a 10-minute break after third section)
(10, 1, 1): Computer-based test: Multiple times a year (depends on availability of the test center)
(10, 2, 1): Paper-based test: Up to 3 times a year in October, November and February
(11, 1, 1): Computer-based test: Can be taken only once after 21 days from the day of exam in every year. Maximum of 5 times a year. (Applies even if candidate cancels scores on a test taken previously.)
(11, 2, 1): Paper-based test: Can be taken as often as it is offered.
(12, 1, 1): About 1,000 test centers in more than 160 countries
(12, 2, 1): (Paper-based test offered only in areas where computer-based testing is not available.)
(15, 1, 1): No official prerequisite. Intended for bachelor's degree graduates and undergraduate students who are about to graduate. Fluency in English assumed.
(16, 2, 1): (Limited offers of "Fee Reduction Program" for U.S. citizens or resident aliens who demonstrate financial need, and for national programs in United States that work with underrepresented groups.)
(17, 1, 1): Most graduate schools in USA, and few in other countries
